intro: Comarostaphylis discolor subsp. discolor, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
